Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 04:21AM eak2863 wrote: Hi All, I am starting chemo on May 5th. I wil have 4 ACs every two weeks followed by 12 weeks of Taxol. 2 weeks ago I got a slylish haircut (like Katie Holmes). I know I have another 2-3 weeks to enjoy it. I did get a wig that is similar to my new hair cut. In addition to a wig, I bought new hats, and something similar to a wig but without a top part, something you can wear with a cap. I think I'll find it more usefull in the summer. Looking forward to chatting with you all and sharing the experience. I hope we all will have an easy 'ride' and grow toghether in the next 6 months.
Posts.Title: Starting Chemo May 2008 KristyAnn Nico1012

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 09:36AM eak2863 wrote: Hi Roxi. I did not want to buy a wig or hats via on-line. You really want to try it on and see if you like it. I am sure you can ask your oncologist or his nurse for a place where you can obtain it in your area. If there is a support group in your area, then you can ask other women for the list of stores. Good luck.

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 12:37PM eak2863 wrote: Roxi, Make sure to ask your onco for a 'wig' prescription. My insurance covers the cost up to $350. I got a nice short wig locally. It is not made of human hair, but looks very natural. Natural hair wigs are more expensive, and I should say they do not look better.

Posts.Content: May 8, 2008 06:34PM eak2863 wrote: Hi to All, Today is day 4 after chemo. Felt very weak last night and in the morning. Feel much better in the afternoon. I think 3d and 4th days are the toughest but manageable. Keep a positive attitude. We will fight bc and concur it. Our lives will return to normal in the next 6-8 months. This is what is important. Good luck.

Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: May 20, 2008 05:53PM eak2863 wrote: Hi Angie and All, Sorry to hear about constipation. Ask your DR if you can use FLEET suppositories. I used them before bc, and used once last week. I had a second AC yesterday, and a Neulasta shot today. Waiting for the side effects to kick in tomorrow and Thursday. I felt nausea and fatique for 10 days after the 1st treatment. I went to an accupanturist today who I feel helped me with some of the side effects 2 weeks ago. Bone pains from Neualsta last a few days after 1st AC, but I took Alleve 1 hr before the shot and the following day as someone recommened on this site.My hair is all over me. But I am not ready to shave. It is day 15 today since I started chemo, so I expect to be bold by the week end. I cover my head around the house to avoid cleaning. Good luck to all.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: May 8, 2008 02:41PM eak2863 wrote: Dear Kristy, Sorry to hear about your experience. I think most of us got Neulasta shot the day after chemo to bust white cells. Make sure you get it he next time(s). Feel better.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 05:03AM eak2863 wrote: Hello, I am around and reading your messages. Had my last 4th AC treatment today. In two weeks will start weekly Taxol - 12 weeks regimen. The side effects after the first AC were pretty bad - nausea and fatique for 10 days out the 14 day. S/E after the second AC were manageable; s/e after 3d were pretty bad. I really felt good the second week after each AC on Thu, Fri, Sat, and Sun. These are the days when you wake and feel as normal as you can be, as if there were no bc diagnose, as if I am not going thru chemo. I tried to socialize and be busy as much as possible to make up  for all the days that I spend at home now, sometimes not even leaving the house for a short walk. It's been 4 weeks since I shaved. or the first few days felt very uncomfortable. Did not want to show my head to my husband, parents and children. But after a few days feelings of discomfort go away. I am comfortable walking bald around the house and family. Did not try to do it in front of friends, but in time I think I'll be OK doing it. I still have a long chemo journey ahead of me. If I do all 12 taxol, I will be done by Sept 15. Here goes the entire summer 2008. I hope everyone is doing well. I see everyone keeps a positive attitude. I think this is the most important thing to be strong, positive, and concur bc once and for all. I wish you all the best.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in April haykat57 angie27
